page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY 5
page.content:
The Tudor and Stuart eras saw some notable{housing}being constructed. 'Y Fferm' is a beautiful Tudor dwelling a few miles north of Caergwrle. The original hall with the pantry and buttery still remain together with some other interesting features.
Plas Teg is another glorious memorial to the past, this time of Jacobean design. Built in 1610 by Sir John Trevor, Plas Teg is a typical example of courtyard housing of that period. Inigo Jones, the celebrated Welsh architect, designed the next addition to the area's dwellings - Bryn Iorcyn which was built in 1620. {(Local history)
